SATIM Nomenclature and Naming Conventions#

To facilitate consistent interpretation, the SATIM model employs a systematic nomenclature for fuel and technology codes. This section provides an overview of the naming conventions used, enabling users to decipher these codes effectively.

Fuel Naming Convention#

Fuel identifiers in SATIM are constructed using a two-component format: the first three letters represent the sector, and the last three letters represent the fuel type. The following tables outline the codes used for each component.

Sector Codes#

Code

Sector

RES

Residential

COM

Commercial

IND

Industrial

TRA

Transport

AGR

Agriculture

…

…

Fuel Codes#

Code

Fuel Type

ODS

Oil Diesel

OGS

Oil Gasoline

NGS

Natural Gas

ELC

Electricity

…

…

Example#

In the fuel code COMODS:

  • COM designates the commercial sector.

  • ODS denotes oil diesel as the fuel type.

This systematic approach allows users to easily parse and interpret fuel identifiers across various sectors.

Technology Naming Convention#

Technological identifiers in SATIM are similarly standardized to ensure coherence and ease of reference. Technology codes typically consist of:

  • The first four letters representing the end-use or application (e.g., space heating, cooking).

  • The next three letters indicating the primary fuel type.

  • Any subsequent letters used as descriptors to provide additional technical details.

Residential End-Use Codes#

The table below lists end-use codes specifically for residential technologies:

Code

End-Use

RHEH

Space Heating

RMEK

Cooking

RLGT

Lighting

RWH

Water Heating

…

…

Example Technology Identifiers#

Identifier

Description

RHEH_NGS_EFF

Represents an efficient residential space heating technology using natural gas.

RCOK_OGS_STD

Refers to a standard residential cooking technology using oil gasoline.

Special Cases#

Certain exceptions to this convention exist. For instance, specific water heating technologies follow slightly modified naming rules. Details on these exceptions are provided in the associated sectoral documentation.

Accessing Detailed Descriptions in VedaOnline#

For comprehensive descriptions of each technology, users may consult the Attribute Master tab in VedaOnline, which provides expanded definitions and specifications. This resource offers valuable insights into the technical characteristics of each technology code used within the SATIM model.

SATIM Nomenclature and Naming Conventions#

To facilitate consistent interpretation, the SATIM model employs a systematic nomenclature for fuel and technology codes. This section provides an overview of the naming conventions used, enabling users to decipher these codes effectively.

Fuel Naming Convention#

Fuel identifiers in SATIM are constructed using a two-component format: the first three letters represent the sector, and the last three letters represent the fuel type. The following tables outline the codes used for each component.

Sector Codes#

Code

Sector

RES

Residential

COM

Commercial

IND

Industrial

TRA

Transport

AGR

Agriculture

…

…

Fuel Codes#

Code

Fuel Type

ODS

Oil Diesel

OGS

Oil Gasoline

NGS

Natural Gas

ELC

Electricity

…

…

Example#

In the fuel code COMODS:

  • COM designates the commercial sector.

  • ODS denotes oil diesel as the fuel type.

This systematic approach allows users to easily parse and interpret fuel identifiers across various sectors.

Technology Naming Convention#

Technological identifiers in SATIM are similarly standardized to ensure coherence and ease of reference. Technology codes typically consist of:

  • The first four letters representing the end-use or application (e.g., space heating, cooking).

  • The next three letters indicating the primary fuel type.

  • Any subsequent letters used as descriptors to provide additional technical details.

Residential End-Use Codes - place this in residential section#

The table below lists end-use codes specifically for residential technologies:

Code

End-Use

RHEH

Space Heating

RMEK

Cooking

RLGT

Lighting

RWH

Water Heating

…

…

Example Technology Identifiers#

Below are illustrative examples of technology codes based on this convention:

  • RHEH_NGS_EFF: Represents an efficient residential space heating technology that utilizes natural gas as a fuel source.

  • RCOK_OGS_STD: Refers to a standard residential cooking technology that operates on oil gasoline.

Special Cases#

It should be noted that certain exceptions to this convention exist. For instance, specific water heating technologies follow slightly modified naming rules. Details on these exceptions are provided in the associated sectoral documentation.

Accessing Detailed Descriptions in VedaOnline#

For comprehensive descriptions of each technology, users may consult the Attribute Master tab in VedaOnline, which provides expanded definitions and specifications. This resource offers valuable insights into the technical characteristics of each technology code used within the SATIM model.
